Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2015 02:38PM resilient74 wrote: Hi there! I was just diagnosed in June. I found the lump 2 days before my 41st birthday. No family history, they said it looked like a harmless fibroadenoma. But then it wasn't. It's definitely a crazy ride. So many appts, tests, more tests. I just had the first of 6 chemos, and there will be surgery, radiation, and herceptin infusions for a full year. But, it's treatable, and I get to keep my breast. So what if I have to lose my hair? It's all only temporary. Trying to stay focused on the positives ;) Much love!
Posts.Title: 41 and just had a baby waiting for confirmation Prettyblueyes KSkier
